descriptions.overview: Sleek aesthetics and plenty of prep space grace the Franke Primo granite kitchen sink, as well as the durability every kitchen needs. The deep 9-in kitchen sink allows for easy, splash-free washing of the large dishes found in every chef's kitchen. The Franke large granite single-bowl sink includes a sanitized built-in protective barrier that fights bacteria both during and between cleaning cycles. Scratch, stain, and heat resistant up to 536˚ F for all of your tough jobs. Other features include a large capacity 9-in deep bowl, dual mount installation, one pre-drilled Hole for a faucet (three additional holes can be knocked out if needed), and a white finish. Minimum cabinet size is 36-in.
list: Functional Design: The sleek aesthetics of the Primo in White bring an elegant and natural look into your kitchen, with easy to clean, high-quality granite, complementing traditional, transitional and modern kitchens alike

Exceptional Quality and Durability: Franke granite sinks are made from 80% quartz, the hardest component of granite, and bonded using high-quality acrylic resins, for a sink that will serve you for years to come
Quiet and Deep Bowls: Enjoy the naturally quiet material and deep bowls of Franke granite sinks, which allows for easier washing of larger dishes
Scratch and Heat Resistant: The high density of granite particles offers superior resistance to scratches, chips and heat
Overall Dimensions: 33-in left-to-right x 22-in front-to-back x 9-in deep
Equal Bowl Interior Dimensions: 14.5-in left-to-right x 17-in front-to-back, Bowl Depth: 9-in
Fits Minimum Cabinet Size of 36-in: Can be installed as a topmount or undermount sink (professional installation recommended for undermount installation)
Everything you need to install: Template and hardware provided with one hole faucet installation
Excellent Warranty: Franke stands behind this product with a Limited Lifetime Warranty

specs.title: Items Required for Assembly
specs.spec: Gloves, silicone sealant, philips screw driver, adjustable wrench

reviews.title: "Do Not Buy This Sink If You Intend To USE It!"
reviews.text: I purchased this sink for a kitchen remodel, the sink was installed for two days but after grouting the tile the sink was terribly stained. (Please note bits of grout had fallen onto the surface of the sink and were there for 10-20 minutes which is normal when grouting.) I tried all the recommended remedies, soft scrub, vinegar, dial soap, nothing removed the stains. I called Franke customer service and was told that they will not pay for a new sink to be installed because they are not responsible for issues from "regular use". Yes, "Regular Use" was a quote from the manager, so don't plan on using this sink regularly unless you want it to look like mine! A sink should not stain when grouting. They do not stand behind their product and they do not take customer service seriously. I will NEVER buy another Franke product and I would highly discourage anyone else from purchasing one as well.
reviews.author: Kelley

reviews.text: We bought this sink since tow weeks and after one week the stains started to appear.. white stains on black sink it looks like dirty sink .. I'm gonna return it to lowes I hope that they will be understanding
reviews.author: Mimi

reviews.title: "Nice Upgrade"
reviews.text: I hated the contractor grade stainless sink in our house, decided to upgrade.I wasn't impressed by the 4 provided mounting brackets, front two were not an option in my installation but I sealed it well with clear sealant on the perimeter. I'm happy with the results. Time will tell if we can keep it looking good.Tip 1: Lay a good bead of clear sealant around the perimeter of the hole in the counter before dropping in the sink. Let it sit for a day before continuing.Tip 2: Mount the faucet and drains on the sink before dropping it in.Tip 3: Lay a good 1/4" bead around the edge of the sink as a final step.
reviews.author: standiego

reviews.title: "So Far So Good Part 2"
reviews.text: I am the same person who reviewed this sink a few months ago with the title So Far So Good. At times I might catch a hard water mark or two but all that is needed is to take the scrub pad and some dish soap and scrub a little bit here and there. It seems to work out just fine. I have very hard water living in Vegas with no softener. I try to be very careful with this sink though in fear of chipping or cracking it from a pot. I haven't had any issues and I really am happy with it for the price and ease of installation. I have added two recent photos.
reviews.author: Monet

reviews.title: "Cracked"
reviews.text: Never looks clean. Was washing dishes and the sink cracked completely on both sides. Only had the sink for a few months. Lowe's directed me to manufacture, Why am I not surprised.
reviews.author: Shauna

reviews.title: "Review after 3 years."
reviews.text: I've now had the sink for 3 years.  Initially, I hated it because I couldn't seem to get it to look clean regardless of what I did.  I was using regular dish soap as advised by the manufacturer, Soft Scrub, baking soda, you name it.  It just didn't look good.  I finally used Scrubbing Bubbles foam one day and it took the sink back to looking like new.  I've had no scratching, no stains, it's held up and looks like the day I purchased it.  We have very hard water here so I occasionally will use vinegar around the faucet and drain to remove the minerals.  If you have a problem with oil/grease spots or streaks, I recommend using Scrubbing Bubbles since it was the only thing that worked for me.  I'd purchase this sink again.
reviews.author: chunx

reviews.title: "So Far So Good"
reviews.text: I installed this sink by myself a couple of weeks ago. I did have some problems. I bought a mocha sink first but when I hammered out the pre-cut holes the sink started to chip and on the last hole it cracked the whole sink in the middle. I took it back to Lowes and exchanged it for this Graphite one. This time I bought a drill and circle saw bit and drilled out the holes slowly. I recommend that you do not use a hammer and punch out but rather drill out your holes. No problems so far for 2 to 3 weeks of use. No stains and no hard water marks.
reviews.author: pingpangpong

reviews.title: "Overall happy with it!"
reviews.text: I love this sink, compared to the standard stainless steel style sinks. It looks sharp and goes well with the new granite countertop I have it under-mounted to. The reasons I went with 4 stars is the first sink I brought home was cracked in three big pieces, so I had to rush back to the store when the countertop guys came to install it. And if you use a paper towel or like product to wipe the sink, pieces of paper can get stuck to the grain of the sink—no biggie, I can use other products just fine. But worth mentioning.
reviews.author: Marcie

reviews.title: "broke in 2 places"
reviews.text: Taking it out of box it broke in 2 places. Broke right off in my hand. (See picture.)As much as I hate stainless steel sinks guess that is what I'm going with!How does granite break.
reviews.author: christina

reviews.title: "Very Good Product"
reviews.text: This sink was pretty easy to install. looks fantastic and cleans up easily. We used the drop in method to replace our old stainless steel sink. The matte finish looks nice and the weight of the sink made it easy to handle compared to a cast iron sink. The only con was the anchoring system. There needs to be some additional tie downs straps added to the sides or another method of anchoring the sink to the counter top.
reviews.author: Doug

reviews.title: "Kholer the name!!!!!"
reviews.text: The best sink I could have ever bought. Durable, stain resistant and most of all very appealing look. The price for this cast iron sink is on point. And my garbage disposal is quiet now, I can barely hear it running. Thanks Lowes for carrying a product worth the money. Nd my new faucet looks great on this sink. Take a look for yourselves
reviews.author: Webster

reviews.title: "Love this sink!"
reviews.text: We installed this sink in October 2016- with a kitchen upgrade. The sink was used in an under mount application with granite. The granite company had no issues as noted- however it did require a mount bracket for our application. The sink size and depth is great for hand washing large bowls and pans. We have hard water in this area and the sink does show a milky haze and or water spots at times. We rub a thin film of Crisco shortening or olive oil on the sink with a paper towel about once a week and it keeps the spots at bay.  I was also told there is a  product that can be applied that lasts about 4 Months. It is reportedly for use on granite and stone. It is a bit pricey 30$ per quart but reported to be worth it. The product is Aqua Mix  stone enhancer. It is sold at a local tile shop. I plan on picking it up for next usage. A friend who has the same sink uses it about two or three times a year and claims it is better and lasts longer than the oil method.
reviews.author: Mickey

reviews.title: "Beautiful workhorse for the kitchen."
reviews.text: I have been using this sink for about a year. A professional installed it with no issues. It holds a turkey size roasting pan. I have no problem keeping it looking nice in the Midwest. But it does show mineral deposits in my Phoenix condo if I allow water to just sit in it, so I have to keep it wiped... which isn't a bad thing. It takes a beating in both kitchen s, it isn't just for show. I am very pleased with the quality and how much it has improved my ability to put the food out and then the cleanup. I gave one to both of my daughters for Christmas.
reviews.author: Barbara

reviews.text: I have not installed this unit yet, but I did install one at my last house and loved it (which is why we bought this one). For those worried about scratching and other issues, I never had a problem with my other sink. You do need to be careful with staining as some things will stain the sink and nothing seems to take out the stain except time.
reviews.author: oodakota

reviews.title: "Don't know yet"
reviews.text: I had a problem installing this sink I followed the instructions to the t. I was breaking out the predrilled hole for the soap dispencer and I broke the sink. I have been doing carpenter work for 40 yrs. The hole was not drilled deep enough , I shouldn't have had to pound that hard on that hole. I had to return the sink put my old sink back in and am now waiting for a replacement.
reviews.author: Archie

reviews.title: "Franke 9-In DBL mocha Trans# 9738857 11-26-17"
reviews.text: Purchased 11/26/17, at Lowes, Rancho Cordova.  On 11/8/18, sink began to leak.  After examination a crack in the bowl was located.  It should be noted that the sink had been well taken care of and no items had been dropped or thrown into the sink.  A Lowe's representative told me they could not assist me and that I would have to contact the manufacturer.  I contacted Franke, KS-Customer Service and provided all necessary paper work and the claim was denied citing that I was negligent in dropping or throwing something in the sink.  I asked them to provide anything that would support that claim.  I can afford to purchase another; however, considering how much money I have spent over the years with Lowe's I don't believe that it is wise to sever me as a customer.   I would like Lowe's to at least examine the sink themselves and represent me as their valued customer!
reviews.author: Tony

reviews.text: I have a brown granite sink and it looks terrible when dry. It looks like the brown is rubbing off. I have no idea what to keep it looking good. The installer told me this would happen but he was ready to install the granite counter top. Too late to change.
reviews.author: Judy

reviews.title: "comes with no drain baskets"
reviews.text: Get a Kraus granite.  This sink came without drain baskets so u have to purchase them.  Most decent ones run $50 AND UP.  We returned and ordered on line thru lowes the Kraus which comes with high quality drain baskets for about $10 more!!  My plumber was impressed!  Plus this sink was heavier than the franke.  U will not be disappointed in the Kraus!!
reviews.author: calliekoo

reviews.title: "Do Not Buy"
reviews.text: We had this sink for a couple days, went to put it in, it barely slipped And knocked a corner and it shattered into pieces. One of the guys at Lowe's said a guy had a pot full of water, dropped it and it shattered, one lady had a vase sitting above her sink, it fell and shattered the sink! Lowe's will not give you your money back! They did give me another sink at cost, but still did not make up for the sink they know is crap! DO NOT BUY, it's total CRAP!!!
reviews.author: Kk

reviews.title: "Great Sink equals Happy Wife"
reviews.text: Purchased this sink as a retrofit replacement for an existing granite countertop. Had to hire contractor to cut opening larger to accommodate new sink. Minimum cutting required and sink dropped right in. Cannot believe how much room this sink has compared to previous relatively same dimension stainless steel sink. Had to drill one additional hole for soap dispenser. Hole comes somewhat predrilled from underside, making job easy. Very easy to plumb. Wife loves her new sink. Great product at a decent price. Color goes great with existing granite. Used new Kohler single handle faucet with soap dispenser. Also found black garbage disposal and sink basket strainers at Lowes. Made finished job look even better. They were a bit pricey, but this drop in sink project came in around $800 total as compared to $6K to change all granite for undermount sink install.
reviews.author: djbnola

reviews.title: "ok quality"
reviews.text: sink was relatively easy to install.  problem with the punch out holes. unless you score the holes, you risk chipping the knockouts when it breaks free.  I had to buy a decorative flange to cover a piece I had to glue back on when it chipped off.  also there was minor imperfections.  ok for the price
reviews.author: campol

reviews.title: "Beautiful Sink"
reviews.text: I upgraded from a stainless steel sink to this Franke granite composite sink and added a Delta Faucet is has made such a difference in my kitchen! I love the look and would recommend this sink to anyone.
reviews.author: BShew

reviews.text: Lookwise - a 5 star.  But, during installation, it cracked.  this happened while it was being carefully dropped in at final installation. Full disclosure, one side went down first but it was only a 1 inch drop to counter.  I don't feel like it should have cracked that easily.  For that reason, I give it a 3.
reviews.author: totaltal

reviews.title: "Sink"
reviews.text: This is is really nice. It is large and and deep. It easy to clean and I love it.
reviews.author: Sc

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Michael

reviews.title: "Beautiful new sink"
reviews.text: This sink looks great and went in without a hitch, I would definitely recommend this product !!!!
reviews.author: Kyscott

reviews.title: "Love it!"
reviews.text: I am absolutely happy with this purchase!  The picture online does not do it justice.  The sink is very deep and you can tell very well made. I definitely recommend this sink.
reviews.author: Jojo

reviews.title: "Ditcher"
reviews.text: Replaced the old sink in my newly purchased home. It made my kitchen look perfect and the quality is great.
reviews.author: AKmom

reviews.title: "Beautiful!"
reviews.text: This is a beautiful sink. Care is so easy and it looks amazing in my newly renovated kitchen
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.text: I just love it . Just alittle oil and luster again
reviews.author: Greg1

reviews.title: "Beautiful Kitchen Sink!!!"
reviews.text: Purchased and installed this sink 3 weeks ago and it it absolutely gorgeous! It replaced a white cast iron sink that had seen better days.  This sink has deep bowls which I love, the cast iron sink didn't. I read that it should have mineral oil applied weekly, which makes the sink look brand new!!! Hope this lasts for a long time.  I just wish that the stainless steel sink grid made for this sink wasn't so expensive.
reviews.author: Gram

reviews.title: "Beautiful sink"
reviews.text: The black color omplements my new kitchen remodel, love the deep sink!
reviews.author: Annie

reviews.title: "Beautiful sink."
reviews.text: We replaced our old stainless steel shallow 2 bowl sink with this. The bowl size is fantastic! And the sink looks awesome. The mounting system could use improvements IMO. It would be helpful if the mfr. or Lowes would make the install manual available to view before purchasing.
reviews.author: Miklb58

reviews.title: "Looks great"
reviews.text: This sink was just what I wanted but unfortunately it was the wrong size for my cabinet. My mistake in measuring. But it looked great right out of the box and I'm sure it would have looked amazing in my kitchen if it fit. Sadly, it had to go back.
reviews.author: MrsPizer

reviews.title: "Looks Great!"
reviews.text: Like this sink so far, it helped in modernizing the appearance of our kitchen. I do wish it came with the drains though but that may be something that does not come with any of them.
reviews.author: wpines

reviews.title: "Great sink if your not an idiot"
reviews.text: Installed sink works great doesn't leak(I know how to plumb). Drilled out hole for RO system DRILLED. however it is hard to clean but we used scrubbing bubbles. Looks like new
reviews.author: Doityoselfa

reviews.title: "What a sink!!!"
reviews.text: I love this kitchen sink. I was tired of my old sink and wanted to go with a look that was not the regular steel/stainless steel sink.
reviews.author: Sallie

reviews.title: "Great quality, fast delivery"
reviews.text: Great sink to replace the other sink I broke installing. “My Fault” fast shipping to my door. Over-all impressed with the experience.
reviews.author: Dale

reviews.title: "Graphite sink"
reviews.text: Looks great! Installed with automatic pull down oil rubbed bronze faucet and matching oil rubbed bronze drain and disposal inserts.
reviews.author: HappyPurchaser

reviews.title: "Looks great"
reviews.text: Hope that is easier to keep looking good.  Had a different brand before that became discolored and could not correct.
reviews.author: Ken

reviews.title: "Kitchen sink"
reviews.text: Very easy to install and looks great with our granite countertops! Only wish we would of went for the undermount
reviews.author: Dathan

reviews.title: "Love it"
reviews.text: Love the textured look and the slightly lowered divider. Single faucet makes it look tidy. Plenty of room.
reviews.author: Tony

reviews.title: "New look"
reviews.text: Love the new look. Works well along with new black stainless appliances. Just what my old kitchen needed!
reviews.author: Elpo

reviews.title: "New sink"
reviews.text: I would also recommend buying a 1 3/8 inch hole saw as it does a great job and makes the job easier
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "Kitchen  sink"
reviews.text: Probably the finest top mount kitchen sink I have ever installed. Also I am a former contractor.
reviews.author: Peter

reviews.title: "Easy installation"
reviews.text: Super easy to install even with minimal to no experience of ever installing a kitchen sink
reviews.author: Billy

reviews.title: "Good sink"
reviews.text: Good sink if you are wanting to match dark appliances. No problems at all so far.
reviews.author: Bryan

reviews.title: "Exactly as advertised"
reviews.text: Conveniently can be installed as a drop in or under mount.  Came as advertised
reviews.author: Brian

reviews.title: "Beautiful Sink"
reviews.text: Beautiful color and very durable. Great price compared to other similar sinks.
reviews.author: Dallas

reviews.title: "Love!"
reviews.text: I love my new sink!Beautiful and sturdy.Love the color and the texture.
reviews.author: April

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: TIm

reviews.text: Sink looks great. It is really deep compared to our previous sink.

reviews.title: "Sharp looking sink!"
reviews.text: Love this sink, goea great with our black and copper fixtures
reviews.author: Amy

reviews.text: Love the sink, we remodeled our kitchen it is perfect

reviews.title: "Graphite double sink."
reviews.text: I am very happy with my double sink. It looks great.

questions.question: "how much does a composite sink weigh"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: FrankeUSASupport
answers.text: Hello, Thanks for reaching out to us. This sink weighs 42 pounds. Thanks, Franke Product Support Team

questions.question: "Does a granite sink need to be treated each year? If not, when?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, it is ideal to seal your granite sink with mineral oil.

answers.author: FrankeUSASupport
answers.text: Hello, Thanks for reaching out to us. We recommend sealing your granite sink with mineral oil. This can be done at any time and will create a protective barrier from hard water deposits or stains. Thanks, Franke Product Support Team

questions.question: "I have had my sink around 6 months now and I can't ever get the sink to look clean. I have water stains, white streaks from bar keeper"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Beth
answers.text: In the reviews one person stated that Scrubbing Bubbles makes this sink look brand new. I haven't tried because I am just getting it installed.

answers.author: FrankeUSASupport
answers.text: Hello, Thanks for reaching out to us. Our apologies for the issues with your sink.Please send us an email at kitchen.us@franke.com so we can assist your further. Thanks, Franke Product Support Team

questions.question: "How do I mount underneath a granite slab"
questions.author: Neil

answers.author: FrankeUSASupport
answers.text: Thank you for your question! We have included undermount clips with the sink; however, it is recommended that you consult a professional installer for this application. Undermounting a sink is a permanent solution for the life of the countertop.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Professional installation is recommended for the undermount installation option.

questions.question: "Is this sink scratch proof, stain proof, and heat resistant?"
questions.author: Megan

answers.author: FrankeUSASupport
answers.text: Thank you for your question! This sink is scratch, stain, fade and heat resistant.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: No, this sink does not have these features.

answers.author: FrankeUSASupport
answers.text: Thank you for your question! This sink is made of composite granite.

questions.question: "Can this sink be ordered with more than one hole for installation of different types of faucets? If not, can extra holes be easily drilled?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: FrankeUSASupport
answers.text: Hello Thank you for your questions. The sink comes with one hole drilled and three holes that are pre drilled and can be knocked out. If we can be of further assistance please contact us at Kitchen.US @ Franke.com Thank You! Barry

questions.question: "Does this sink show hard water spots?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: FrankeUSASupport
answers.text: Hello Thank you for your question. We have had instances of customers noticing hard water spots. We recommend using white vinegar and cleaning with Bar Keepers Friend Soft Scrub. We also recommend a periodic sealing with mineral oil to help the sink keeps its luster. If you need further assistance please contact us at Kitchen.US@Franke.com Thank You! Franke Product Support Team

questions.question: "What size drain do I need for this sink?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: FrankeUSASupport
answers.text: Hello, Thanks for reaching out to us. This sink has a 3.5 inch drain opening. Thanks, Franke Product Support Team

answers.author: FrankeUSASupport
answers.text: Hello, Thanks for reaching out to us. This finish is more matte than shiny. Thanks, Franke Product Support Team
